intro: Mariscus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy mariscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or calcareous soils. Mariscus pubescens is typically herbaceous, growing as an annual or biennial plant with a compact, bushy habit.
